comments:
Mylar Version 1.0 with Jira/Subversion

I have 3 repository queries from which I pick
one task to work on. 
After working on one task for a while, Only the "Archived Tasks"
list
(within the Task List View) has some items listed, the other "live"
queries (e.g.
My open assigned Issues, etc.) have no data. Clicking the
"Refresh" button does access
the repository, but does not show any additional
data.

The Exception below occured when
trying to view the properties of a query.

The Workaround to get the queries to list all
tasks was the following:
- Open view Task Repositories
- Open Properties of the Jira Repository
-
Without changing password or anything click on "Validate Settings"
-> Settings were validated
ok, click OK.
- Click on "Refresh" in the Task List
-> Queries are working again...


Any
ideas?

Brgds Andreas

-- Error Log --

Had your ip changed between when you had query hits and when they went missing? Has this occurred since?

Yes, this is a known bug, and it might be related to the IP change as Rob points out.  I added a note to the FAQ: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#JIRA_Connector_troubleshooting
Since this report provides more details I'll mark the other as duplicate.
*** Bug 167339 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Rob,
no, the IP address did not change. Yes, the problem occurs all the time.

It seems that when working on a task, after some time, the task list cannot sync any more. Sometimes (if the plus/minus sign left of the query folder icon is not present), you can get the list to show the items using dropDown|Expand All. (Even then, the plus/minus signs do not show up).

Sometimes, it seems to be just broken. "Sychronize All Tasks and Queries" does something, but does not lead to a visible result in the task list.

This is most annoying... and leads to not showing updates from the repository and not be able to switch to another task until you perform the workaround. Do you have any solution yet?

;-)

Thanks again
Andreas

Renamed the bug from "Hits missing from query when not authenticated (Jira)" to "Connector is loosing connection to Jira repository after a while" so that the problem is reflected in a better way.
Set the component to Jira.

Eugene: are you seeing this too?  We could explore fixing, but I'm wondering if we need JIRA core services integrated for this (bug 165389).  I guess that the temporary work-around would be to do the "test" reset as is done in the repository validation.  We could try that for 1.0.1 so tentatively setting milestone.
I haven't seen it lately. But on the other hand I currently have automatic synchronization disabled. Perhaps adding this workaround for now is a good idea.

I have this problem too. I'm using BEA workshop for struts (Version: 3.2.1, Build id: 589). Thanks for providing this good tool to us! Hopefully, this bug can be fixed soon. Jira connector is important to us. :)

Regards,
Joe Wang

I have added a work-around to reset the settings every time that a query is synched.  It should not be too expensive, and is definitely better than having to do this manually when the failure occurrs.  Those having a problem please update to a test build that will be available in the next few hours via the following update sites:
  for 3.2: download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/test/e3.2  
  for 3.3: download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev 
  
Further improvements should be made once we integrate JIRA Core Services (bug 165389).
